p: The inhibitory infectivity of CATH-B1 was dose-dependent ( Figure 2), with an almost complete inhibition of viral infectivity of the H1N1 and H3N1 strains, while inhibition of H5N1 reached 85% ( Figure 2). The observed reduction in infected cells was not due to toxicity of cathelicidins toward the mammalian cell lines as shown by the WST assay ( Figure 3). Nevertheless, cytotoxicity was observed for CATH-1 and CATH-3 at 10 Î¼M to HD11 cells ( Figure 3A).
